Mailman in Use and in the News

Mailman was featured in a cover story article in the March 1999 issue of SunWorld. The article was written by Cameron Laird and Kathryn Soraiz.

Mailman was briefly mentioned in a ZDNet article on GNU/Linux. This was picked up by MSNBC (I won't comment on the irony there).

The following sites (in no particular order) are known to use Mailman or Mailman technology to run their mailing lists. If you'd like to be included in this list, please let us know.

  • Apple Computer, Inc.
  • Exite@Home
  • Dell Computers
  • The XFree86 Project, Inc.
  • VA Linux
  • SourceForge
  • FreshMeat
  • XEmacs.Org
  • ListServe.com
  • tummy.com (lots of Linux lists)
  • RedHat, Inc.
  • Samba
  • KDE Project
  • Pair List
  • Python.Org
  • Zope.org
  • Zope.com (Yay!)
  • GNOME.Org
  • Exim.Org (see also Nigel's htdig extensions in action for searchable archives)
